instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> , from no power to power, then no power
threads.message:
having a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board, had liquid spilled on.
<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> was bad and replaced. then <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> came out.
it powered on but no back light, fixed that as well. then ran testings in OS.

found battery not being recognized. X mark,traced down to the SMC. and replaced it...

damn then the machine has no power on , green light is NOT there. check pp3v42 and ppbus g3h,which are fine.

then thought can be a bad SMC, replaced another two ... same story. then traced down and checked <CHIP>U6901</CHIP>.. pin 1 and 2 gets 2.8v.. pin 4 and pin5 are around 3.4-.3.4

doubting on pin 1 and pin2 . (2.8v), thinking should be around 3.3-3.4 as well.

any suggestion?

really don't think the SMC is the issue at this moment now, since replaced 3 times already( do this often and it's not from donor boards, from solid supplier . preprogramed SMC for this model..i actually just used the first one we tried to replace ,reballed and used on another board, and fixed that one, so pretty sure it's not the SMC)

thinking if anything around the SMC got heated up too much and got affected??

any suggestion or experience on this?

thank you

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> , from no power to power, then no power
threads.message: Make sure you have a connection between pin 1 of <CHIP>U6900</CHIP> and pin 4 of <CHIP>U6901</CHIP>. Also, What is SYSONEWIRE and SMC BC ACOK VCC measuring? Also see if you have ADAPTER SENSE.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> , from no power to power, then no power
threads.message: SMC BC ACOK is too low I believe. Check your soldering on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and replace it again.... I seem to get some dud ISLs every now and then.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> , from no power to power, then no power
threads.message:
Is <RESISTOR>R5087</RESISTOR> corroded? This is under the heatsink so not visible if you are examining with heatsink on.

Is <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> fluctuating between 16.6v to 16.1v rapidly on pin 1 or 2 of <DIODE>D7005</DIODE>?

Is <SIGNAL>PP5V1_CHGR_VDDP</SIGNAL> consistently present?
